channel.title: Ramen on Table41NYC
channel.description: Recent content in Ramen on Table41NYC

item.title: Menkoi Sato
item.description: This is the old Mew Men place. Pretty good ramen. The spicy is actually spicy, and the broth is super flavorful. The only caveat is there is not a lot of stuff that comes with the soup. Just a few veggies, and that’s it. They should have some sort of combo or something.

item.title: Shinshi Ramen
item.description: Pretty good tsukemen. Get the spicy miso. Tsukemen seems fairly rare in NYC. Still looking for something similar to LA Tsujita.

item.title: Ramen Shack
item.description: Decent ramen. Got some super fancy ramen, and it was fat. Not the best though and it’s in a not so great neighborhood.

item.title: Wanpaku
item.description: Decent ramen in the Greenpoint area.

item.title: EAK Ramen
item.description: Actually pretty good. Get the spicy. I think this is up there with Totto Ramen for favorite NYC ramen places.

item.title: Jin Ramen
item.description: This place was decent. Had to wait about 20 minutes. I think price wise it’s slightly cheaper than East Village stuff.

item.title: Niu Noodle House
item.description: Beef noodle ramen was not as good as Taiwanese beef noodle. Passssss.

item.title: Ramen Ya
item.description: For whatever reason, there are 2 locations within neighboring vicinity of each other in the West Village. The ramen is similar to Shinsengumi. Slightly disappointed.

item.title: Totto Ramen
item.description: I think this is still one of my top favorite ramen places in NYC. It’s cash only.

item.title: Mentoku Ramen
item.description: It seems I only wrote “pretty good” on my spreadsheet, and right now I am drawing a blank about this place.

item.title: Momosan Ramen
item.description: It’s ok. Broth is not great, but tuna bowl is good. I think this restaurant is owned by Morimoto.

item.title: Kuu Ramen
item.description: Not good at all. Was near WTC.

item.title: Momofuku Noodle Bar
item.description: Super salty and overrated. The only good Momofoku restaurants is Fuku (the fried chicken joint) and Ko (the michelin star).

item.title: Ippudo
item.description: Overrated and pricey. I’d skip here any day of the week. Daikokuya in LA is way better.

item.title: Zundo Ya
item.description: It’s just ok.

item.title: Ramen Misoya
item.description: Recommended by Totto Ramen server for best thick noodle in NYC. Soup was bad and salty. But yeah the noodle was pretty good.

item.title: Jun Men Ramen Bar
item.description: It’s similar to Shinsengumi. If in Chelsea and want ramen, Oramen is way better.

item.title: Oramen
item.description: This place is pretty good for the area. I like the miso.

item.title: Yuji Ramen
item.description: Ramen omakase. Really good. Everything is homemade. $130 per person.

item.title: Ryujin Ramen
item.description: It’s just ok. I’d go to other ramen places over this.

item.title: Ichiran
item.description: A little expensive but pretty good. It’s like a much better version of Shinsengumi.
